page.title: 03AMMANFORD'S WEEKLY MARKET
page.content: A survey was conducted in Ammanford's Friday market, with 20 shoppers and 12 stall holders being interviewed. It was found that 90% of the shoppers lived within 6 miles of Ammanford, 40% living in the town itself. Over half the people had travelled in by car, only 2 came by bus; this could be why 30% suggested the parking facilities should be improved. Almost 75% of the shoppers said they came to the market because it was cheap, indeed 55% said they attend weekly and 65% had bought items on that particular day. Of the stall holders, 3 came from Swansea and 6 from other places in SE.Wales. Over half said they found the town's facilities good, that trade was fair but that business had fallen during the 1984-85 coal strike and trade had not yet recovered.
